Fy enw i'n Jen Amnielenned, rydw i'n byw ar 43 gwystiau ym Wresel.
Rydw i'n bryd i un pwmpen gorauol cael Mark yn Amnielenned.
Rydyn ni wedi'i gynnal 2014, y 5 o September 2014.
Roedd yn dda iawn o'n dda i mi.

Mae'n dda iawn oherwydd?

How did Mark propose?
With a wedding ring.
With a wedding ring?
Yes.
What happened?
We got married in a posh hotel in a, I can't remember the name of the place,
but I don't think the hotel's there anymore.
I think it's closed down or somebody's overtaken it.
Basically we stayed in a hot tub and the hot tub was absolutely out of this world.
We were in the hot tub, fully naked, and we were both absolutely pissed out of our heads.
I meant we were drunk.
We were drunk.
Basically I wasn't well on the day I got married because I was sick with diarrhea and everything,
so that really upset me on the night.
Was that a nervous tummy?
It was because of the tummy and everything.
It upset me because it went all over my wedding dress,
but it's cleaned and it's been taken to the dry cleaners and everything,
so it's washed and cleaned.
I'll say it really.
How did Mark propose to you? Did you have a day?
I proposed because the vicar or somebody in the place married us, so I got married there.
How did Mark ask you to marry him?
Talking about it for years and years about getting married, so...
He was just asking me.
Did he get down on one knee?
No, he was just talking about it and asking me, and we arranged it,
and we had a lot of help from different people.
Who did you have help from?
Just friends of mine and friends of his and his family as well.
Why did you need help?
To organise it and everything.
To organise the wedding?
Yeah, and to get funded for it and pay for it.
So...
Was that easy or was it quite difficult?
No, it was quite easy. I had that first but managed to do it.
So who did you ask first for help? Who did you go to first?
Credit Union.

And they helped you get married?
Yes.

Yes.
So were you born in Wrexham?
Yes.
And did you move away and come back or have you always lived here?
No, I've not always lived in Wrexham.
